source.randomOffsetForTracks: Use random offsets for different tracks

javascript.dragToImport: Drag and drop to import the {{item, lowercase}}

selectInfo.videoEvent: {{count}} video track event has been selected
selectInfo.videoEvent_other: {{count}} video track events have been selected
selectInfo.audioEvent: {{count}} audio track event has been selected
selectInfo.audioEvent_other: {{count}} audio track events have been selected
selectInfo.trackEventOnlyOne: You must select exactly ONE track event, not more or less
selectInfo.videoEventOnlyOne: You must select exactly ONE video track event, not more or less
selectInfo.audioEventOnlyOne: You must select exactly ONE audio track event, not more or less
selectInfo.trackGeneratedGeq: {{count}} or more tracks will be generated
selectInfo.videoTrackGeneratedGeq: {{count}} or more video tracks will be generated
selectInfo.audioTrackGeneratedGeq: {{count}} or more audio tracks will be generated

descriptions.condition: Specify when the following configuration will be applied

source.trim: Adjust start or end time of the specified source
source.startTime: Specify when to start generating from the project

score.trim: Intercept the generation time range of the score
score.constraint: Controls the note output length from the score
score.encoding: Specify the text encoding for reading the file

stream.stretch: When on, the clip will be stretched instead of changing its duration
stream.loop: When the clip is lengthened to the end of the source media, playback will start over
stream.normalize: Normalizes the audio, useful if the audio is quiet
stream.staticVisual: Freezes the frame at the start of the clip

noLengthening.visual: Freezes the frame at the end of the clip if the note is longer than it
noLengthening.audio: Does not lengthen the clip if the note is longer than it

stream.createGroups: Creates groups for video and audio clips represented by one note
stream.glissando: Creates a swirl effect if the note pitch bends or slides
stream.autoPan: Pans the audio using envelope automation
stream.mapping: Maps the properties of notes to the specified item
stream.transformMethod: Specifies which target properties to apply the transformed keyframes

tuning.stretchAttributes: More config about the select tuning method
tuning.resample: Locks stretch and pitch, adjust the stretch to change the pitch
tuning.preserveFormant: Keeps the voice tone while tuning
tuning.basePitch: Specifies what is the base pitch of the audio event

effects.staff: Uses custom patterns as notes to draw visuals similar fashion to piano staff sheets
effects.pixelScaling: Scaling using nearest neighbor hard edges amplification and interpolation algorithms

track.useInGeneration: Uses in generated tracks instead of selected tracks
track.gradient: Makes the video tracks have a gradient style color effect in your layout
track.legato: Fills the gaps between the track clips

sonar._: Sonar is utilizing the shapes of Cookie Cutter to create beat-style visuals for drum kits.

shupelunker._:
Shupelunker Tactics are an untuned otomad tactic. It is used to play the melody by using a clip of the source (usually a vocal) at the same pitch as the melody, that is, the source clip itself is pitched to match the melody.
If the pitch of the clip does not match the melody, “Tartar Tactics” will be generated. It is also untuned, and allows you to choose where the clip is cut (usually at a dialogue), with audio stretching and rewinding often used, as well as adding sixteenth to sixty-fourth rest notes. During the production, the clips will be aligned with the rhythm for singing sense.

ytp._:
YouTube Poop (YTP) is for creating nonsensical videos using various effects known in the YTP genre. YTP supports multi-source.
YTP is a Neo-Dada art form, which is absurdist remixes that ape and mock the lowest technical and aesthetic standards of remix culture to comment on remix culture itself. It consists of video remixes that are edited from a large array of video clips in order to confuse, stun or amuse the viewer. The sources can be mashed all together into a nonsensical Crossover story, or just repeat footage of the characters gesticulating oddly.
ytp.constraint: Controls the length for the clip to generate

mosh.normal: Datamosh is a technique of damaging clips to create glitchy effects.
mosh.additional: In video art, there is a technique called datamoshing. Where two videos are interleaved so intermediate frames are interpolated from two separate sources. And exploits the difference in how the separate video codecs process motion and color information.
mosh.datamosh: Datamoshes the video, preferably on the timeline with a lot of movement visuals
mosh.datamix: Applies the movement of a clip to the visual of another clip
mosh.layer: Does multi-layering, by copying the video clip many times
mosh.render: Prerenders a part of the timeline which may contains very complex video edits, and replaces it with a single video clip
mosh.scramble: Cuts the clips into a lot of subclips, and shuffling the subclips
mosh.automator: Adds random keyframes every frame automatically for each effect you added to the video clips
mosh.stutter: Stutters the clips by forwarding and reversing them in randomized intervals
mosh.shake: Shakes or wiggles the clips by using Pan/Crop

tools._: These QoL functions make creating YTPMVs/Otomads a little less painful for working with or setting up. These don’t require any adjustments to any of the previous parameters.
tools.selector: Finds and selects all clips that match the specified
tools.replacer: Replaces multiple clips with specified new clips
tools.normalizer: Normalizes all selected audio clips volume
tools.subtitles: Presets the “Titles & Text” preset, and then add multiple lines of text here
tools.visualizer: Applies the PV Rhythm Visual Effects to the selected video clips
tools.fader: Adjusts gain (volume/opacity) for selected clips with the specified rules
tools.scoreExporter: Exports the clips in the selected tracks to a score sequence file
tools.flow: Creates stunning animations using Beziér Curves

converters.tuningMethod: Switches the tuning algorithm to the selected audio clips
converters.timeSignature: Converts the selected music time signatures between 4/4, 3/4, 6/8, etc

staff._:
Staff Visualizer is to use custom patterns as notes to draw visuals similar fashion to piano staff sheets based on the melody of the score.
This visual effect style mimics the videos of YouTuber @grantwoolard, who featured the use of musicians’ avatars to draw the piano staff sheets of classical music.

pixelScaling._:
Pixel Scaling feature can enlarge and replace the pixel image of the source with a new image to avoid the pixel distortion problem caused by the original pixel image rescaling using smooth gradients algorithm due to Vegas Pan/Crop. To use it, you could add FFmpeg to system environment variable, or you could directly install Datamosh extension pack.
Pixel Scaling feature will use FFmpeg to enlarge the source file using the nearest neighbor interpolation algorithm to fit the current project size, and then replace the source media file in Vegas with the newly generated media file. The newly generated file will be identified by adding the suffix “_Scaled” to its name. The feature theoretically supports any image/video file format, and also supports image sequence files imported into Vegas through conventional methods.

settings.about: Otomad Helper, a YTPMV/YTP extension for Vegas Pro, designed to allow Vegas to accept scores like MIDI files as input, and automatically generate YTPMV tracks.

ytpEnabled.title: YTP enabled, all other related parameters are unavailable
ytpEnabled.details: Disable YTP feature to use and adjust other parameters
